issues.title: Mapping of Keys to Verification Methods and Relationships
issues.author: rodolfomiranda
issues.body:
The goal is to define a univocal mapping between the keys in the KEL and the `verificationMethod` property,  and the Verification Relationships `authentication`,  `assertionMethod`, `keyAgreement`, `capabilityInvocation` and `capabilityDelegation` properties of the DID Document. 

From @pfeairheller [presentation](https://keriworld.slack.com/archives/C0552BPRN5D/p1682704423143979):
* Verification Methods:
    * KERI public signing keys
    * Other keys committed to by AID
        * Keys derived from public signing keys (encryption)
        * Anchored in KEL (using cryptographic digest)
        * BADA (Best Available Data Acceptance) Policy
* Verification Relationships:
    * Authentication and assertion assigned to KERI public keys
    * Other types represented by key role BADA data

From [ietf-did-keri](https://github.com/WebOfTrust/ietf-did-keri):

> For each key K in the Key State, add a Verification Method to the DID Doc containing K and the appropriate type, with the ID of K being K's prefix form (alternatively, the ID could be an integer of K's index in the current signer list)

I think we need to start defining:
* How to identify other keys anchored in the KEL. Should a specific seal format be defined to cover all possible cases defined in the DID Spec?
* key Id generation for each key
* Mapping of BADA roles to relationships

pulls.title: Reference to Peer DID
pulls.author: rodolfomiranda
pulls.body: I'm not sure if a reference to Peer DID should go in the spec, but if we leave it, it should point to the [Method 1](https://identity.foundation/peer-did-method-spec/#generation-method) of the DID Peer Spec that use the genesis and patches.

pulls.title: Remove "Service" disclaimer
pulls.author: rodolfomiranda
pulls.body:
I think the following text should be omitted in the new version of did:keri:

>The following field is not a core field in a did:keri DID document: `Services`. The did:keri method is provided for interoperability for the purpose of using KERI to establish control authority of the current public keys associated with KERI identifier behind the keri:did DID. It is anticipated that KERI tunnel methods (eg. did:indy:sov:keri) will provide these features to enable addition interop.

pulls.title: Introduction of the three approaches
pulls.author: rodolfomiranda
pulls.body: This is the starting point for describing the three approaches for resolving a KERI DID.

pulls.title: Remove escape backlashes in blocks of code
pulls.author: rodolfomiranda
pulls.body: backlashes for escaping special chars are not needed in the block of code
